alert.note: Alert for Coconino (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 11 at 4:47PM MST until August 11 at 6:15PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: The National Weather Service in Flagstaff has extended the * Flash Flood Warning for... Coconino County in north central Arizona... * Until 615 PM MST. * At 446 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain in again moving into the warned area. Between 0.25 and 1 inch of rain has fallen. Additional rainfall of 0.75-1 inch will be possible. Flash flooding is likely ongoing and expected to continue. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life-threatening flash flooding of low-water crossings, creeks, normally dry washes and roads. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Grand Canyon National Park and Navajo Reservation. This includes the following highways... U.S. Highway 89A between mile markers 542 and 548. This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Badger Canyon, Jackass Creek, Colorado River and Soap Creek. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Flooding of washes and creeks will occur, some dirt roads will become muddy and impassable. Paved roads and underpasses could become flooded as well. Remain alert for flooding even in locations not receiving rain. Normally dry washes, slot canyons and creeks can become raging killer currents in a matter of minutes, even from distant rainfall.
